meanings.sent1: The slimy texture of the food made me feel ew.
meanings.sent2: The smell coming from the garbage can was so ew.
meanings.sent3: When I accidentally touched the sticky gum under the table, I couldn't help but go ew.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the moldy bread in the fridge was enough to make anyone go ew.
meanings.sent5: The ew feeling I got from the dirty restroom lingered long after I left.

meanings.definition: Used to show that something is unpleasant or gross.
meanings.sent1: The ew stain on the carpet was hard to clean.
meanings.sent2: The spoiled milk had an unmistakable ew smell.
meanings.sent3: The slimy slug on the sidewalk was definitely an ew sight.
meanings.sent4: The ew taste of the expired yogurt lingered in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The ew sensation of stepping on a squishy bug made me shudder.

meanings.definition: An interjection used to show disgust or revulsion.
meanings.sent1: Ew! What is that awful smell?
meanings.sent2: Ew, I can't believe you just ate that!
meanings.sent3: Ew, why would you touch that dirty sock?
meanings.sent4: Ew, the thought of eating bugs makes me cringe.
meanings.sent5: Ew, the slimy texture of the snail made me recoil in disgust.
